key_points: YouTube has suspended President Trump's channel for at least a week due to concerns over 'ongoing potential for violence' following the US Capitol riot.
YouTube is also disabling all comments on Trump's channel indefinitely.
Trump is permanently banned on Twitter and banned on Facebook at least until President-elect Biden's inauguration.
Jim Steyer, CEO of Common Sense Media, calls YouTube's action an 'important and necessary first step' and suggests it should become permanent.
Google announced a pause on political ads on its platforms until after Inauguration Day to prevent the spread of misinformation and exploitation of the Capitol siege.
Parler registered its domain with Epik, known for hosting far-right services, after being removed by Amazon Web Services and app stores.
Parler is suing Amazon for alleged antitrust violations over its expulsion.
This article also includes brief mentions of actions taken by other tech companies against misinformation, as well as other tech and media news.
Apple announces new projects related to its $100 million pledge for racial equity and justice.
Lars Lehne is named group CEO of Incubeta, and Julie Eddleman joins DoubleVerify as EVP and global chief commercial officer.
